title: Study on the High Reliefs of the Medes Time in Kermanshah
abstract: This article deals with the study of high relief s in Kermanshah in the Median era. The purpose of this article is to perform a more accurate study of high relief s in Kermanshah in the Median era and analyze them artistically in order to have a detailed comparison with other time periods. The method of this research is library-documentary, which means the needed information are firstly collected and then analyzed. The result of this research shows this issue that although the Medes have benefited by the cultural heritage of neighbors like the Elamite s and Assyrian s, but they have been able to process all those effects over time and create a new unique style.

motivations: There is a need for a more accurate study of high reliefs in Kermanshah from the Median era to understand their artistic significance.
A detailed comparison of Median era high reliefs with those from other time periods is lacking.
objectives: Conduct a thorough study of high reliefs in Kermanshah from the Median era.
Analyze the artistic aspects of Median era high reliefs to identify their unique characteristics.
methods: Employ a library-documentary research method to collect and analyze relevant information.
results: The study reveals that the Medes developed a unique artistic style by processing the cultural influences of their neighbors over time.

motivations: There is a need for a more detailed and accurate study of the high reliefs in Kermanshah from the Median era.
A comprehensive artistic analysis and comparison of these high reliefs with other time periods is lacking.
objectives: Perform a detailed study of the high reliefs in Kermanshah from the Median era.
Analyze these high reliefs artistically and compare them with other time periods.
methods: Use a library-documentary research method to collect and analyze the necessary information.
results: Despite the Medes' cultural influences from neighbors like the Elamites and Assyrians, they were able to create a unique style over time.
openai_json.research_subject: Artistic study and analysis of the high reliefs from the Median era in Kermanshah

motivations: There is a need for more accurate and detailed study of high reliefs from the Median era in Kermanshah to better understand their artistic characteristics.
Previous analyses have not adequately compared Median high reliefs with those from other time periods to identify their unique stylistic features.
objectives: Perform a comprehensive study and artistic analysis of high reliefs in Kermanshah from the Median era.
Conduct detailed comparisons between Median high reliefs and those from other time periods to identify distinctive characteristics.
methods: Library-documentary research approach involving collection and analysis of existing information about Median high reliefs.
results: The Medes developed a unique artistic style by processing cultural influences from neighboring civilizations like the Elamites and Assyrians.
Despite benefiting from neighboring cultural heritage, the Medes created distinctive high reliefs that represent their own artistic identity.
anthropic_json.research_subject: High reliefs of the Median era in Kermanshah
